p: In the secondary endpoint analysis, although Part III scores decreased between the start of medication and the 29 th day of treatment, the difference was not significant (Fig. 2; Table 2), and scores for MDS-UPDRS Parts I, II, and IV were not significantly different between the 29th or 57th day and the pre-treatment values (Table 2). Subjective evaluation of change in disease severity with treatment was performed by patients (or care-givers) as well as the study's physician investigators (or sub-investigators) and the analysis shown in Table 3. Patients evaluated that disease severity had significantly improved by the 57th day ( P = .0056) but not at the 29th day ( P = .2649). In contrast, the physicians had evaluated that disease severity had improved by both the 29th ( P < .0001) and 57th days ( P = .0012).
